channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Your Next Customers Won’t Find You on Google
item.description: The most profound shifts in technology don’t just change how people find things. They change who starts the search.

item.title: Apple Has a Blunt Message for European Users: The DMA Is Making Your iPhone Worse
item.description: The iPhone maker wants changes to the law that it says will be better for users.

item.title: 5 ways to keep yourself from overspending on social media’s niche trends

item.title: Apple is delaying its live translation for Europeans because of their pesky red tape
item.description: Apple was already fined after the Digital Markets Act took effect last year.

item.title: Fast-fashion retailer H&M group closed 135 stores, but its profits and stock are soaring. Here’s why
item.description: The H&M group is entering the fall season with style. On Wednesday, September 24, the retailer released its third-quarter earnings and reported an ope...

item.title: Stablecoins are everywhere, but one expert argues that the ultimate winner might not even exist yet
item.description: In the latest episode of the Crypto Playbook, professor and former Paxos executive Austin Campbell argues why stablecoins are poised to break out of c...

item.title: This Former FBI Agent Says You Should Practice ‘Slow Thinking’ to Protect Against Scams
item.description: New data from Visa shows that online scams targeting businesses are on the rise. But there are smart steps you can take to avoid them.

item.title: Meet Lindsey Halligan, the 36-year-old former Miss Colorado hopeful who only worked 3 federal cases before Trump promoted her to U.S. attorney
item.description: Halligan, who competed in the Miss Colorado USA pageant twice, will now lead one of the nation's most important federal prosecutor offices.

item.title: Ned Fulmer’s podcast episode about his cheating scandal is being roasted online

item.title: Gen Z is reviving this boring job that millennials and boomers abandoned—and it’s helping them land six-figure careers straight out of college
item.description: About 75% of accountants are expected to retire in the next decade, and some Gen Zers are realizing that the field is not so boring after all—especial...

item.title: Starbucks is closing stores and laying off 900 people in $1 billion restructuring
item.description: Starbucks will end the year with fewer stores and fewer employees. But the brand maintains that it’s all part of a greater turnaround still in the mix...

item.title: Want to Change How People Think About Your Product? Pick the Right Color
item.description: Medical device maker Insulet’s new collaboration with Pantone aims to shift sentiment. Here’s why it may work.

item.title: ‘Sponge cities’ architect, Yu Kongjian, dies in plane crash in Brazil

item.title: Aldi Got Sued for Being a Copycat. What It Did Next Was Brilliant
item.description: After the owner of Oreos and Ritz crackers sued Aldi for copycat packaging, Aldi made a big change. It’s a lesson for every company.

item.title: Gen Zers are dating people 25% better than they are. They’re calling it ‘throning’—and experts say it’s a quick ticket to long-term success
item.description: Dating experts say “throning” works—it just depends on how your treat your ex and your newfound network.
